TestDescription.name: WordPress 3.8.2 security release
TestDescription.Description:
WordPress 3.8.2 is now available. This is an important security release for all previous versions and we strongly encourage you to update your sites immediately. [break][break]
This releases fixes a weakness that could let an attacker force their way into your site by forging authentication cookies. This was discovered and fixed by Jon Cave of the WordPress security team.[break][break]
It also contains a fix to prevent a user with the Contributor role from improperly publishing posts.[break][break] This release also fixes nine bugs and contains three other security hardening changes:[break] [ul] [li] Pass along additional information when processing pingbacks to help hosts identify potentially abusive requests. [/li] [li] Fix a low-impact SQL injection by trusted users. Reported by Tom Adams of dxw. [/li] [li] Prevent possible cross-domain scripting through Plupload, the third-party library WordPress uses for uploading files. Reported by Szymon Gruszecki. [/li] [/ul]
TestDescription.Impact: An attacker may force their way into your site by forging authentication cookies.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest version of WordPress.
